title: Recycled Water Distribution System
description: The Project consists of constructing a recycled water pump station and electrical building inside the City’s wastewater treatment plant, a new 900,000 gallon recycled water storage tank near Priska Drive, the Buena Vista turnout facility, a de-chlorination station at Barney Schwartz Park, auger bore crossing of Highway 46, approximately 18,000 LF of 6-inch to 24-inch distribution pipelines with appurtenances, approximately 16,000 LF of 2-inch and 4-inch fiber optic conduit with handholes, and electrical and remote control systems for a complete in-place operational recycled water distribution system.

title: City Hall Remodel - Design
description: The attached Request for Proposals (RFP) describes the general project background and scope of services for remodeling Paso Robles City Hall. Located on the second floor of the City Hall/Library building at 1000 Spring Street, City Hall houses the City Managers Office and the Community Development, Public Works and Utilities Departments.

title: Construction Management and Inspection Services AMI Water Meter Retrofit Project
description: The City of Paso Robles (City) invites qualified firms to submit a proposal to provide construction management, inspection, and related services to support implementation of an Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) Retrofit Project. The City will solicit bids from pre-qualified Contractors for installation of AMI water meter registers and appurtenances, including AMI cellular radio endpoints and AMI-compatible lids for approximately 10,910 meters, and includes replacement of approximately 312 existing water meter bodies that are not compatible with the AMI system.  The Construction Management consultant’s scope of work will include comprehensive construction management services described in this request to support the successful completion of the AMI Retrofit project.

title: CDBG 17th Street Pedestrian and Road Repair Improvements (Partially CDBG Funded)
description: The work generally includes but is not limited to removal and replacement of PCC curb ramps, curb, gutter, spandrel, sidewalk and cross gutters, paving and restriping, and full depth reclamation for paving repairs, on 17th Street from Chestnut to Spring Street, all as shown on the plans and/or as specified herein.
